Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rabbi Joseph Potasnik, Executive Vice President Board of Rabbis: Senior Rabbi, Congregation Mt. Sinai, 250 Cadman Plaza, Brooklyn, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Yassky.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Joseph Potasnik, Executive Vice President Board of Rabbis: Senior Rabbi, Congregation Mt. Sinai, 250 Cadman Plaza, Brooklyn, N.Y.

Council Member Yassky moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting March 12, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member McMahon.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member McMahon moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 12, 2008 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications

Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Dennis P. Gallagher - Submitting his resignation as a member of the New York City Council effective April 18, 2008.

Items.Title: Land Use Call-Ups
Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees

Resolution urging the Governor of the State of New York to issue an Executive Order to the State Agencies under his control mandating the procurement of Recycled Plastic Lumber (RPL) where it is a viable alternative to natural or chemically treated wood and urging the State Legislature to enact legislation mandating municipalities to do the same.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Contracts
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Mandating the procurement of Recycled Plastic Lumber (RPL) where it is a viable and potentially economically efficient alternative to natural or chemically treated wood.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Environmental Protection

A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the office of operations, the office of environmental coordination and an office of long-term planning and sustainability.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on GO with Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Creation and implementation of a comprehensive environmental sustainability action plan for NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and the repeal of local law number 55 for the year 2007.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reducing greenhouse gas emissions and the repeal of local law number 55 for the year 2007.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the State Department of Health to study and to regulate the exposure of nurses to toxic substances.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Department of Health to study and to regulate the exposure of nurses to toxic substances.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to permitting senior citizens residing in multiple dwellings the right to maintain pets in such dwellings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Permitting senior citizens residing in multiple dwellings the right to maintain pets in such dwellings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to school recycling.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: School Recycling

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Department of Education and the Department of Sanitation to immediately implement school recycling programs in all New York City public and private schools.
Items.AgendaNote: Sanitation and Solid Waste Management and Education
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: DOE and the Dept of Sanitation to immediately implement school recycling programs in all NYC public and private schools.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training building inspectors.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Training building inspectors.

Items.Title: to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of buildings to post on its website the number of fatalities and accidents at construction sites.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Department of buildings to report the number of fatalities and accidents at construction sites.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass the Summer Jobs Stimulus Act of 2008.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass the Summer Jobs Stimulus Act of 2008.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and the repeal of local law number 55 for the year 2007.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Reducing greenhouse gas emissions and the repeal of local law number 55 for the year 2007.

Items.Title: Resolution finding that the enactment of Preconsidered Int. No. 756 does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with The State Environmental Quality Review Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Enactment of Preconsidered Int. No. 756 does not have a significant adverse impact on the environment and is consistent with The State Environmental Quality Review Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring usage of fully shielded light fixtures.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring usage of fully shielded light fixtures.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass bill S 7000, which requires the State Department of Health to implement a permit process for exhibitors commercially displaying human remains.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: State Department of Health to implement a permit process for exhibitors commercially displaying human remains.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating and disseminating a best practices at construction sites within the city of New York manual.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creating and disseminating a best practices at construction sites within the city of New York manual.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a construction industry whistleblower hotline within the New York City department of buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Creating a construction industry whistleblower hotline within the New York City department of buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Health to study the effects of fluoride in tap water.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Department of Health to study the effects of fluoride in tap water.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the appointment of a safety compliance officer with respect to construction sites.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: The appointment of an independent monitor with respect to construction sites.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to the posting of signs at construction sites.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Posting of signs at construction sites.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the continued violence in Colombia and calling upon all parties to cease all violent attacks against civilians and respect their human rights.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the continued violence in Colombia and calling upon insurgent armies to cease all violent attacks against civilians and respect their human rights.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to small business regulatory flexibility.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Small business regulatory flexibility.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to classifying housekeeping violations as immediately hazardous, certifying correction of immediately hazardous housekeeping violations, adding civil penalties for violations of stop work orders.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Classifying housekeeping violations as immediately hazardous.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring owners of construction sites to clean graffiti from the construction site and any construction-related materials at no cost to the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring owners of construction sites to clean graffiti from the construction site and any construction-related materials at no cost to NYC.

Items.MinutesNote: The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum).
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, May 14, 2008.

HECTOR L. DIAZ, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.MatterName: Landmarks, American Bank Note Company Printing Plant, Bronx (20085310HKX)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 080099(A) ZMM, pursuant to Sections 197-c and 201 of the New York City Charter and proposed modification pursuant to Section 2-06 (c) (1) of the Uniform Land Use Procedure, for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Sections Nos.  5c, 6a & 6b.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Application no. Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Resolution urging the Department of Education and the Department of Sanitation to immediately implement school recycling programs in all New York City public and private schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE and the Dept of Sanitation to immediately implement school recycling programs in all NYC public and private schools.
